page.title: 14Kingsway/Aldwych 05300181
page.content:
At the south end of{Kingsway} is the imposing entrance to Bush House - beautiful at night - from here the BBC's World Service and 35 vernacular language services are broadcast. Their motto being "Nation shall speak peace unto Nation". Next door to Bush House is Australia House - the Australian Embassy and across the{Aldwych}is the London School of Economics. In front of the Law Courts is the Royal Air Force church St Clement Danes rebuilt by Sir Christopher Wren and outside embedded in the pavement are emblems of the RAF. St Clement Danes has been immortalised in the first line of a nursery rhyme:
"Oranges and lemons says the bells of St Clements"
